intro: Codonoboea bakoensis var. bakoensis, commonly known as the Bako endemic, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Cameroon. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are usually pink or purple in color. This species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
